data: On the morning after the frolic on the island, as the young friends called it, when the breakfast was over, where the merriment of the affair, and the return of Henry Clavering had been discussed, and the ladies were left to themselves, topics were introduced which belonged only to the initiated, that is, to the womenkind.
Woodburn Grange: A story of English country life; vol. 2 of 3
browsing: literature|browsing: religion/spirituality/paranormal|browsing: fiction|category: romance|category: novels|category: british literature
